snippet: Although the government has liberalized many aspects of agriculture, inefficiencies caused by central control mean that many Cubans are actually seeing less food at private markets.
abstract: Cuban government has liberalized many aspects of agriculture, including steady rollout of incentives for farmers, but by most measures, project has failed; inefficiencies like poor management, policy constraints and transportation limits caused by central control mean that many Cubans are actually seeing less food at private markets.
lead_paragraph: Although the government has liberalized many aspects of agriculture, inefficiencies caused by central control mean that many Cubans are actually seeing less food at private markets.

headline.seo: Changes to Agriculture Highlight Cuba’s Problems
headline.main: Cuba’s Free-Market Farm Experiment Yields a Meager Crop
headline.print_headline: Cuba’s Free-Market Farm Experiment Yields a Meager Crop
